data.title: "Skip Mode" in Ren'Py Launcher for 6.17.0.282
data.body:
The word "Skip Mode" appeared while I was using the Ren'Py Launcher, then it disappeared after a few screens (and some keyboard presses). I don't know what triggered it and I don't know what made it go away.

![20140223](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/2226326/2240218/66101414-9c80-11e3-9142-7127391135e4.png)

data.title: Traceback initializing Ren'Py 6.17
data.body:
I decompressed 6.17 and started it up.  It informed me that it couldn't find Tkinter and was falling back to using the directory I'd decompressed Ren'Py in as the game directory.

Clicking 'New Project' then gave me a traceback complaining that 0xfb isn't ASCII.  I suspect it's being confused by BOMs in files.  If it's relevant, my locale is set to 'en_US.UTF-8'.

--- Traceback ---
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/launcher/game/tkaskdir.py", line 34, in <module>
    from Tkinter import Tk
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/lib-tk/Tkinter.py", line 42, in <module>
    raise ImportError, str(msg) + ', please install the python-tk package'
ImportError: No module named _tkinter, please install the python-tk package

Full traceback:
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/execution.py", line 294, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ast.py", line 732, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/python.py", line 1358, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/project.rpy", line 599, in <module>
  File "game/project.rpy", line 363, in scan
  File "game/project.rpy", line 384, in scan_directory
  File "/home/tom/ab/x64lucid-deps/install/lib/python2.7/posixpath.py", line 71, in join
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xfb in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)

While running game code:
  File "launcher/game/new_project.rpy", line 68, in script call
  File "game/project.rpy", line 542, in script
  File "game/project.rpy", line 599, in python
  File "game/project.rpy", line 363, in python
  File "game/project.rpy", line 384, in python
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xfb in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)
--- End traceback ---
Subsequent attempts to start renpy.sh give:
--- traceback ---
Full traceback:
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/execution.py", line 294, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ast.py", line 732, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "/home/gametest/tmp/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/python.py", line 1358, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 263, in <module>
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 218, in fancy_activate_editor
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 133, in fancy_scan_editors
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 86, in scan_all
  File "/home/tom/ab/x64lucid-deps/install/lib/python2.7/glob.py", line 16, in glob
  File "/home/tom/ab/x64lucid-deps/install/lib/python2.7/glob.py", line 41, in iglob
  File "/home/tom/ab/x64lucid-deps/install/lib/python2.7/glob.py", line 43, in iglob
  File "/home/tom/ab/x64lucid-deps/install/lib/python2.7/posixpath.py", line 71, in join
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xfb in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)

While executing init code:
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 27, in script
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 263, in python
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 218, in python
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 133, in python
  File "game/editor.rpy", line 86, in python
UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xfb in position 1: ordinal not in range(128)
--- End traceback ---

data.title: renpybidi cannot detect Glib2 includes
data.body:
http://sl1pkn07.no-ip.com/paste/view/f41d4a59

```
pkg-config --libs fribidi
-lfribidi -lglib-2.0
```

```
pkg-config --cflags glib-2.0
-I/usr/include/glib-2.0 -I/usr/lib/glib-2.0/include 
```

add:

CFLAGS+=" $(pkg-config --cflags glib-2.0)" python2 setup.py build

solve the problem

data.title: Change single_track and shuffle exclusive
data.body:
single_track and shuffle are incompatible.
I prevent both of them from being True at the same time.

data.title: using the renpy Lexer for another project
data.body:
Hi there!

I'm currently writing some kind of a web based story engine, based on HTML5 websockets, javascript and cherrypy. The whole concept is to build something very similar to RAGS but on HTML/HTTP basis.

I'm now at a point where I need some text engine where stories can be described and gives me some text output. 

Personally I really like the format of renpy stories and would also like to use this for my project.

Is this even possible? Calling the lexer and binding commands to a custom class? Or is it so deep in the complete renpy that it does not make sense at all?

Where should I start?

Thanks for your response :-)

data.title: "name 'style_backup' is not defined" in choose_theme.rpy
data.body:
When creating a new project or changing the theme, following exceptions occur:

When creating a new project (when the theme chooser should pop up):

```
﻿I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "launcher/game/new_project.rpy", line 123, in script call
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 474, in script
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 476, in python
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 93, in python
NameError: name 'style_backup' is not defined

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/execution.py", line 294, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ast.py", line 732, in execute
    renpy.python.py_exec_bytecode(self.code.bytecode, self.hide, store=self.store)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/python.py", line 1358, in py_exec_bytecode
    exec bytecode in globals, locals
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 476, in <module>
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 93, in implement_theme
NameError: name 'style_backup' is not defined

Linux-3.2.0-58-generic-x86_64-with-debian-wheezy-sid
Ren'Py 6.17.0.282
Ren'Py Launcher 6.17.0.282
```

When ignoring this exception, another pops up when hovering over the window:

```
﻿I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  File "launcher/game/new_project.rpy", line 123, in script call
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 478, in script
  File "renpy/common/000statements.rpy", line 447, in python
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 145, in python
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 93, in python
NameError: name 'style_backup' is not defined

-- Full Traceback ------------------------------------------------------------

Full traceback:
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/execution.py", line 294, in run
    node.execute()
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ast.py", line 1595, in execute
    self.call("execute")
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ast.py", line 1613, in call
    renpy.statements.call(method, parsed, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/statements.py", line 144, in call
    return method(parsed, *args, **kwargs)
  File "renpy/common/000statements.rpy", line 447, in execute_call_screen
    store._return = renpy.call_screen(name, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/exports.py", line 2014, in call_screen
    rv = renpy.ui.interact(mouse="screen", type="screen", roll_forward=roll_forward)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/ui.py", line 237, in interact
    rv = renpy.game.interface.interact(roll_forward=roll_forward, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/core.py", line 1993, in interact
    repeat, rv = self.interact_core(preloads=preloads, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/core.py", line 2570, in interact_core
    rv = renpy.display.focus.mouse_handler(ev, x, y)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/focus.py", line 251, in mouse_handler
    return change_focus(new_focus, default=default)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/focus.py", line 229, in change_focus
    rv = widget.focus(default=default)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/behavior.py", line 584, in focus
    rv = run(self.hovered)
  File "/opt/renpy-6.17.0-sdk/renpy/display/behavior.py", line 224, in run
    return var(*args, **kwargs)
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 145, in __call__
  File "game/choose_theme.rpy", line 93, in implement_theme
NameError: name 'style_backup' is not defined

Linux-3.2.0-58-generic-x86_64-with-debian-wheezy-sid
Ren'Py 6.17.0.282
Ren'Py Launcher 6.17.0.282
```

When I ignore this exception, I see the main screen of the launcher again.

This also happens when I click on `Change Theme` in the launcher.

It happens both in the nigthly build (19.02.14) and the released version. I'm running elementary OS 0.2 (which is based on Ubuntu 12.04), 64 bit.

Sorry for bad grammar.

data.title: hover tt.Action resets keyboard focus
data.body:
When I focus a button which has hover tt.Action by keyboard, the focus position is reseted and I can't focus these buttons.
On the following codes, display buttons can't be selected by keyboard

```
screen preferences:
    default tt=Tooltip("")
    text tt.value align (.5,.9)

        frame:
            style_group "pref"
            has vbox

            label _("Display")
            textbutton _("Window") action Preference("display", "window") hovered tt.Action("window")
            textbutton _("Fullscreen") action Preference("display", "fullscreen")  hovered tt.Action("window")
```

data.title: $PYTHONHOME warnings when launching latest nightly and 6.16.5 SDK
data.body:
I am using **Slackware Linux 14.1 x86**, and the **Ren'Py SDK 
ver. 6.16.5**. When I launch the SDK using the ./renpy.sh script 
included, everything works perfectly except for a warning which 
is continuously being thrown. It reads as follows:

```
Could not find platform dependent libraries <exec_prefix>
Consider setting $PYTHONHOME to <prefix>[:<exec_prefix>]
```

This variable is indeed unset, but none of my other python 
programs complain about it, because my python install is in the 
default search path. I have **Katawa Shoujo** (which uses 
**Ren'Py  6.10.2e**) on this same computer, and there is no 
error when I run it, implying that it may be an issue specific to
this release.

I am not familiar with how the Ren'Py version and its renpython 
interact with the shell, but the error clutters up my log files and 
stderr. It also persists through a release, which I was able to test 
by "Building Distributions" of the tutorial and the question. Both 
of these, when packaged for distribution for Linux x86, throw 
this warning upon execution.

This makes distribution and development using this version of 
the SDK or nightly build ugly. It does not, however, break 
anything. Google, and the Forums on Lemma, both do not have 
any information on the subject. In other projects (which do not 
have a dedicated version of python, requiring a system version 
instead) this issue is usually due to nonstandard library 
installation... and the variable being unset.

I am still looking for a solution, and was wondering if this is a 
known issue. Thanks for Your time, and sorry if I missed
something obvious.

data.title: fix doc error ("width" -> "height" in ysize description)
renpy.input() documentation is incomplete
data.body:
In renpy/exports.py, the description for pixel_width of renpy.input() is broken:

```
    `pixel_width`
        If not None, the input is limited to being this many pixels wide,
        in the font used by the
```

Maybe, the following is correct:

```
    `pixel_width`
        If not None, the input is limited to being this many pixels wide,
        in the font used by the input string.
```

data.title: Crash on old android version
Fast Skip is interrupted by window show
data.body:
If a label is like this:

```
label start:
    #if you start fast skip here

    e "This line will be skipped if it's seen."
    e "This line will also be skipped."

    window hide

    pause 0.5

    e "This line will be skipped too."

    window show

    e "Fast Skip stops here."
    e "This line won't show up with Fast Skip."

    return
```

Fast Skip stops right after window show.

data.title: Predict call followed by return.
data.body:
In code like:

```"..." # A
call foo
show whatever

label foo:
    "..."
    return

```

"whatever" is not predicted at point A. That's because we predict call and return, but not both.
```

data.title: A White Tulip doesn't support other languages
data.body:
So I heard many people who want to use, or are using theme A White Tulip.
But it won't show non-English languages without deep knowledge of ren'py, so they're wondering what is wrong, spending meaningless time on searching a way to fix this.
I think it shouldn't have font dependency, or at least state it's not supported non-English languages when people are selecting a theme on the launcher.

data.title: Inconsistency with Yes/No Prompt
data.body:
When using a transparent png image for the Yes/No Prompt background, it will overlap the previous background when the prompt appears except when pressing the X button of the window to exit the game in a menu (it happens in all menus screens, but not when the game is running), creating an inconsistency.

Notes:
The user Crazy Li reported this issue didn't happen with Renpy 6.13, but will happen from the following version onward.

Images attached:
![bug yesno prompt 1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6564457/2059221/e90b13d4-8b9e-11e3-8b22-82e344069456.png)
![bug yesno prompt 2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6564457/2059227/0a050a40-8b9f-11e3-96b4-112cb4e998a8.png)
![bug yesno prompt 3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/6564457/2059228/0d3d7e22-8b9f-11e3-9ddf-a4dde23591e7.png)

A demo of a game for windows to reproduce the issue can be downloaded here: http://www.mediafire.com/download/djgf3puaymftvvi/Bug%20transparent.zip

Steps to reproduce:
1. In the main menu, press the "Quit" button to see how the gray.png image overlaps with the background when the yes/no prompt appears.
2. In the main menu again, press the "X" in the corner of the window to exit the game. Notice how when the yes/no prompt appears the menu background is removed.
3. Press "Start Game", and then press the "X" in the corner of the window to exit the game. Notice how the gray.png image overlaps correctly if the game have started.

data.title: Automatic nvl-clear when block goes off the window
data.body:
RenPy currently has automatic line breaking. When a line's width is too  long to fit in the window, it's automatically broken into multiple lines  displayed one below the other.
I propose a similar system that would make sure blocks don't bleed off  the bottom of the screen the way they currently do. It's very  frustrating (and at times difficult to notice) when a line (or even  worse, a single word) is never displayed because RenPy renders it  outside of the window.
Having RenPy catch that and do an nvl-clear before the overflowing block  would be very convenient. Even if it is not desired behaviour, it will  at least be obvious that there's an overflow and then the writer will  fix it by doing an explicit nvl-clear where he wants it.

---

An alternative way to address this issue would be scrolling rather than  doing an nvl-clear. This will help the reading flow more naturally. I  personally find animated scrolling more appealing, but: On the one hand,  non-animated scrolling is easier to implement and is less annoying for  the reader on slow scrolling speeds, but on the other hand,  animated-scrolling feels more "polished", doesn't bother the user on  fast scrolling speeds, and in fact helps the reader keep track of where  he is in the text.

data.title: Mouse hide doesn't work in full screen mode

data.title: Will not start if the path to the game contains : or ;.
data.body:
: on Linux/Mac, ; on Windows.

This is because python uses :/; as a delimiter when figuring out pythonhome/exec_prefix. It gets confused when the path contains one of these characters, leading to a crash.
